Draw a Bar Plot for KEGG Enrichment Results

Source: R/plotenrichbar.R
plotenrichbar.Rd

Creates a horizontal bar plot to visualize KEGG enrichment results, with bars colored by p-value significance.

plotenrichbar(
  results,
  top = 25,
  title = "Overview of Enriched Metabolite Sets",
  low_color = "#FF0000",
  high_color = "#FFFF00",
  bar_width = 0.8,
  base_size = 12,
  wrap_width = 40,
  show_ratio = TRUE,
  color_limits = c(0, 0.2),
  legend_position = "right"
)

Arguments

results

A data frame containing KEGG enrichment results as returned by `enrichkegg()`. Must contain columns: `Description`, `EnrichmentRatio`, `pvalue`, `p.adjust`.

top

Number of top enriched pathways to display (default = 25)

title

Plot title (default = "Overview of Enriched Metabolite Sets")

low_color

Color for the most significant p-values (default = "#FF0000" - red)

high_color

Color for the least significant p-values (default = "#FFFF00" - yellow)

bar_width

Width of the bars (default = 0.8)

base_size

Base font size for the plot (default = 12)

wrap_width

Number of characters per line for wrapping pathway descriptions (default = 40)

show_ratio

Logical indicating whether to display enrichment ratio values on the bars (default = TRUE)

color_limits

Range of p-values for the color scale (default = c(0, 0.2))

legend_position

Position of the legend ("none", "left", "right", "bottom", "top", or two-element numeric vector; default = "right")

Value

A ggplot2 object representing the enrichment bar plot.

Details

This function creates a horizontal bar plot where:

  • Each bar represents a KEGG pathway

  • Bar length corresponds to the fold enrichment

  • Bar color indicates the p-value (red = significant, yellow = non-significant)

  • Pathways are ordered by adjusted p-value (most significant at the top)

Examples

if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{
# Assuming 'enrich_results' is output from keggenrich()

# Basic plot
plotenrichbar(enrich_results)

# Customized plot
plotenrichbar(
  results = enrich_results,
  top = 15,
  title = "Top Enriched Pathways",
  low_color = "darkred",
  high_color = "lightyellow",
  bar_width = 0.7,
  base_size = 14,
  wrap_width = 30,
  show_ratio = FALSE,
  color_limits = c(0, 0.1),
  legend_position = "bottom"
)
} # }
